Package game

Class GameWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.World
      • game.GameWorld
  • public class GameWorld
extends World
    Class representing the game world, including the locations of all Actors, the player, and the playing grid. This game word can have a safety system. Player can either lose, win or quit game.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.World

        actorLocations, display, maps, player

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameWorld​(Display display)
      Constructor that initialises display to display object given, and quit and quit to false to indicate player has not quit or win this game.

      Sets the quit sentinel to true to indicate player has quit the game.

      Sets the safety system of this game world to the safety system given.

      void winGame()

    • Method Detail

      • setSafetySystem

        public void setSafetySystem​(SafetySystem safetySystem)
        Sets the safety system of this game world to the safety system given.
        Parameters:
        safetySystem - safety system to be set to this game world

      • stillRunning

        protected boolean stillRunning()
        Returns true if the game is still running. The game is considered to still be running if the player is still around and player has not quit and has not win the game.
        Overrides:
        stillRunning in class World
        Returns:
        true if the player is still on the map.

      • processActorTurn

        protected void processActorTurn​(Actor actor)
        Gives an Actor its turn if the game is still running, also runs safety system on Actor if Actor is player. The Actions an Actor can take include:
        • those conferred by items it is carrying
        • movement actions for the current location and terrain
        • actions that can be done to Actors in adjacent squares
        • actions that can be done using items in the current location
        • skipping a turn
        Overrides:
        processActorTurn in class World
        Parameters:
        actor - the Actor whose turn it is.

      • endGameMessage

        protected java.lang.String endGameMessage()
        Return a appropriate string that can be displayed when the game ends when player quits, wins or loses.
        Overrides:
        endGameMessage in class World
        Returns:
        the string "Bye!" if player quits, "Player wins!" if player wins, "Player loses!" otherwise

      • quitGame

        public void quitGame()
        Sets the quit sentinel to true to indicate player has quit the game.

      • winGame

        public void winGame()
        Sets the win sentinel to true to indicate player has won the game.
